subjects: Israel-Gaza War (2023- ); Palestinians; Evacuations and Evacuees
abstract: Israel said the operation was carried out in coordination with the U.S. and others, and that 68 people, including sick and injured patients and their escorts, were allowed to leave.

headline: Israel Orders Evacuations in Gaza City as Palestinians Report Strikes
subjects: Israel-Gaza War (2023- ); Palestinians; Civilian Casualties
abstract: Palestinian officials and residents said heavy strikes hit the Shajaiye neighborhood of Gaza City and reported multiple casualties. The Israeli military said it could not immediately comment on the strikes.

abstract: Europe will need to navigate turmoil at home and a potential Trump presidency abroad. These people were picked to steer its institutions for the next five years.

headline: Israeli Minister Will Release Palestinian Funds if Settlements Are Legalized, Officials Say
subjects: Israel-Gaza War (2023- ); Palestinians; Israeli Settlements; Banking and Financial Institutions
abstract: Under a tentative deal, Israel’s far-right finance minister, Bezalel Smotrich, would help the Palestinian Authority stave off financial collapse if five illegal West Bank outposts are authorized.

subjects: Defense and Military Forces; Israel-Gaza War (2023- ); United States International Relations
abstract: A recent flurry of diplomacy aims to head off a conflict that could pit the United States directly against Iran.

abstract: The results from Friday’s election, which drew record-low turnout for a presidential race, will force a runoff on July 5 between a reformist and an ultraconservative.
